thag8.3:1.1: When I first saw the Teacher
thag8.3:1.2: who fears nothing from any quarter,
thag8.3:1.3: I was struck with a sense of urgency,
thag8.3:2.1: Anyone who, having found such a Teacher,
thag8.3:2.3: is like someone who, when Lucky Luck comes to them,
thag8.3:2.4: would drive her away with their hands and feet.
thag8.3:3.1: Then I left behind my children and wives,
thag8.3:3.3: I had my hair and beard cut off,
thag8.3:4.1: Endowed with the monastic training and livelihood,
thag8.3:5.1: Then a wish occurred to me,
thag8.3:5.3: I wouldn’t sit down, not even for a moment,
thag8.3:5.4: until the dart of craving was pulled out.
